question: What matters more in losing weight: what you eat, or how much you work out?
question_content:
I know that both are essential. But a few years ago, I dropped 15+ lbs just by eating less and working out a few times a week (not very hard at that). I gained those 15lbs back due to stress and life. I'm not worried about losing it, but I'd like to speed up the process a little (better start now, rather than continuing to gain). I work out 5-6 times a week, and have cut back on what I eat... Just not the extent of the first time I lost the 15. 

Would it be more efficient to eat even less than I am, and cut back on working out a little? I've been going at this for a month or so and have only lost about 4 lbs, which I fluctuate over. I'm not sure what the problem is. I would really like to get this off, so I am willing to try anything (within reason! And in a healthy manner, of course!)

Any suggestions?! Thanks!!!

answers.answer_content:
I'd rather work out harder, and of course cut out grassy food and all that bad stuff;) good luck hopefully you drop all the lbs. you dont want no more;)
Ps. After you drop all those lbs you need to keep doing excersise or you gonnna gain those lbs back
